intro: Cirsium greimleri, commonly known as the Greim's thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring spiny leaves and a purple to pinkish flower head. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
